member.summary: Measures the all legend cell and calculates the column widths.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Components.Map.Legend.TallTableLayout
member.summary: Represents tall table layout for map legend.
member.remarks: Algorithm used: 1) for each item in legend: - if item is not fitted horizontally, than items can not be fitted - if item is not fitted vertically, than try to create new column - try to place item in last column 2) if there is more than 1 column, try to justify number of rows: - try to reduce number of rows in all except last columns by 1, shifting items to last column - if last column fits vertically, than repeat, otherwise stop

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Components.Map.Legend.WideTableLayout
member.summary: Represents the wide table layout for map legend.
member.remarks: 1) for each item in legend: 1. try to place item in new column 2. if item is not fitted vertically, than it can not be fitted at all, so finish 3. if item is not fitted horizontally, than try to free space for it in last column: - find the column with minimum height that can fit by height after increasing row number by one (height of next cell should be checked) - if there is no such column, than cannot fit all items, so finish - otherwise increase it's row number and shift all items to left, place current item in last column - if after items shifting they are not fitted horizontally, than remove last column and repeat steps above until all items from removed column fit

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Components.Map.Data.GeoShapeSimplifier
member.summary: Represents an implementation of RamerDouglasPeucker algorithm, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramer%E2%80%93Douglas%E2%80%93Peucker_algorithm.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Components.Map.Data.GeoShapeSimplifier.Simplify(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Drawing.PointF})
member.summary: Simplifies the specified line points, the algorithm degenerates the line having one distinct point to empty.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Components.Map.Data.GeoShapeSimplifier.Simplify(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.IItemCollection{System.Drawing.PointF},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Simplifies the curve by removing points the distance between which is less than the allowable. Brief. 1. Measure the curve part. 2. If part of the line is more than a allowed size - split curve on two parts, and Simplify them recursively. 3. If part of curve is less then allowable and 3.1 Degradable == False (which means that entire shape processed at current step) - split curve on two parts and Simplify them recursively. As a result, we obtain a triangle. 3.2 Degradable == True (which means that part of curve processed) - curve degenerates to straight line.
member.param: Start of range where curve must be simplified.
End of range where curve must be simplified.
If True the method returns at least three points. Otherwise, the curve may disappear.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimeMultipart
member.summary: Creates Multipart/related MIME files simliar to saving a MHT file from IE. Theoretically you could use this class to generate email messages too, but it is specifically targed at creation of MIME MHTML (RFC 2557) documents. As of now this class is creating a multipart/related content type.

The value that to be used for the From header of this message/document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimeMultipart.Subject
member.summary: Sets or returns the value of the Subject header for this part.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimeMultipart.Boundary
member.summary: Returns the a unique MIME boundary per instance used between parts in of the MIME document. Each instance of this class will have a unique boundary.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimeMultipart.CreateNewBoundary
member.summary: Creates a new boundary that should be very random.

remarks.para: Excerpt from RFC2046: The Content-Type field for multipart entities requires one parameter, "boundary". The boundary delimiter line is then defined as a line consisting entirely of two hyphen characters ("-", decimal value 45) followed by the boundary parameter value from the Content-Type header field, optional linear whitespace, and a terminating CRLF.

member.param: The to write the MIME compatible data to.

member.summary: Writes the current multipart MIME document to the specified TextWriter.

member.summary: Contains the headers and content for a part of a mime document.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.ContentTypeKey
member.summary: Used internally to access the Content-Type header in the collection.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.ContentTransferEncodingKey
member.summary: Used internally to access the Content-Transfer-Encoding header in the collection.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MimePart class.
member.param: Initializes the property to the specified value.
The MIME "Content-Transfer-Encoding" value. The value specified in body will be encoded according to this value. See the property for details on what values are supported.
An array of bytes containing the body of the part.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.ContentType
member.summary: Sets or returns the value of the Content-Type header for this part.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.TransferEncoding
member.summary: Sets or returns the value of the Content-Transfer-Encoding header.
member.remarks:
The following Transfer-Encoding values are supported at this time:
base64
quoted-printable
7 Bit ASCII, (although no additional encoding will be done by this class for 7bit) Others may be specified, but no encoding will be done on the body if the encoding is not recognized.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.ContentID
member.summary: Sets or returns the value of the Content-ID header.
member.remarks: This value can be used to link embeded s together. For example if the first MimePart is HTML, an img tag's src attribute can be prefixed with "cid:" and then the value of another 's property to specify the that contains the image to be displayed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.Headers
member.summary: Returns the collection of Headers for this part.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.Body
member.summary: Sets or returns the body of this part as an array of bytes.
member.remarks: The body should not contain any headers, use the property for access to the headers of this part. The body should not contain multipart boundaries, it is the job of the parent Multipart to put boundaries between each part.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.MimePart.WriteTo(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes this part's headers and content to the specified writer.
member.param: The to write this parts data to. Typically, due to the MIME standard, this writer should be using ASCII 7 bit character encoding and CRLF (carrage return character + line feed character) for the NewLine property.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.QuotedPrintableEncoding
member.summary: Implements the Quoted-Printable Content-Transfer-Encoding specified in RFC 2045 (6.7).

remarks.para: (Excerpt from RFC 2045): The Quoted-Printable encoding is intended to represent data that largely consists of octets that correspond to printable characters in the US-ASCII character set. It encodes the data in such a way that the resulting octets are unlikely to be modified by mail transport. If the data being encoded are mostly US-ASCII text, the encoded form of the data remains largely recognizable by humans. A body which is entirely US-ASCII may also be encoded in Quoted-Printable to ensure the integrity of the data should the message pass through a character-translating, and/or line-wrapping gateway.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.QuotedPrintableEncoding.UpperCaseHexDigit
member.summary: Value is the hexidecimal digit coorisponding the integral value used as an index. For example, use 15 as an index, and get F back. Used in the QuotedPrintable encoding function.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.IO.Mht.QuotedPrintableEncoding.Encode(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes the specified array of bytes according to the Quoted-Printable Content-Transfer-Encoding.
member.param: The writer to write output to.
The array of bytes to encode.
member.returns: The new array of bytes encoded according to the rules of Quoted-Printable.
member.remarks: Note if you have unicode characters that you want to encode, you need to run them through another character encoding scheme first such as UTF8 or another code page specific encoding to first get bytes out of them. Whoever reads the resultant bytes will obviously need to know the character encoding that is to be used to decode the data after the quoted printable decoding is done. For example, in HTML the body can be encoded according to a variety of character encodings, and the character encoding used is noted in the HTML header's Content-Type field using the charset parameter.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType

member.summary: Attribute type not specified.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.CDATA
member.summary: The attribute contains text (with no markup).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.ENTITY
member.summary: The attribute contains an entity declared in a DTD.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.ENTITIES
member.summary: The attribute contains a number of entities declared in a DTD.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.ID
member.summary: The attribute is an id attribute uniquely identifie the element it appears on.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.IDREF
member.summary: The attribute value can be any declared subdocument or data entity name.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.IDREFS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) declared subdocument or data entity names.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NAME
member.summary: The attribute value is a SGML Name.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NAMES
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) SGML Names.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NMTOKEN
member.summary: The attribute value is an XML name token (i.e. contains only name characters, but in this case with digits and other valid name characters accepted as the first character).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NMTOKENS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) XML NMTokens.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NUMBER
member.summary: The attribute value is a number.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NUMBERS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NUTOKEN
member.summary: The attribute value is a number token (i.e. a name that starts with a number).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NUTOKENS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of number tokens.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.NOTATION
member.summary: Attribute value is a member of the bracketed list of notation names that qualifies this reserved name.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.SgmlReader.AttributeType.ENUMERATION
member.summary: The attribute value is one of a set of allowed names.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Strict
member.summary: Specifies that the incoming encoded data is checked for validity before being decoded. For example, an input string of "𣎴" would decode as U+233B4, but an input string of "��" would fail to decode properly.
member.remarks: Already-decoded data in the string is not checked for validity. For example, an input string of "\ud800" will result in an output string of "\ud800", as the already-decoded surrogate is skipped during decoding, even though it is unpaired.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Compat
member.summary: Specifies that incoming data is not checked for validity before being decoded. For example, an input string of "�" would decode as U+D84C, which is an unpaired surrogate. Additionally, the decoder does not understand code points in the SMP unless they're represented as HTML-encoded surrogates, so the input string "𣎴" would result in the output string "𣎴".

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Loose
member.summary: Similar to 'Compat' in that there are no validity checks, but the decoder also understands SMP code points. The input string "𣎴" will thus decode into the character U+233B4 correctly.
member.remarks: This switch is meant to provide maximum interoperability when the decoder doesn't know which format the provider is using to generate the encoded string.

member.summary: Constructor for CssStyleSheet

member.summary: Used to find matching style rules in the cascading order

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssStyleSheet.DeleteRule(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to delete a rule from the style sheet.
member.param: The index within the style sheet's rule list of the rule to remove.
member.exception: INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the style sheet's rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this style sheet is readonly.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssStyleSheet.InsertRule(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to insert a new rule into the style sheet. The new rule now becomes part of the cascade.
member.param: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.

The index within the style sheet's rule list of the rule before which to insert the specified rule. If the specified index is equal to the length of the style sheet's rule collection, the rule will be added to the end of the style sheet.
member.returns: The index within the style sheet's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.
member.exception: INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the style sheet's rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this style sheet is readonly.
HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at the specified index e.g. if an @import rule is inserted after a standard rule set or other at-rule.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified rule has a syntax error and is unparsable.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssStyleSheet.CssRules
member.summary: The list of all CSS rules contained within the style sheet. This includes both rule sets and at-rules.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssStyleSheet.OwnerRule
member.summary: If this style sheet comes from an @import rule, the ownerRule attribute will contain the CSSImportRule. In that case, the ownerNode attribute in the StyleSheet interface will be null. If the style sheet comes from an element or a processing instruction, the ownerRule attribute will be null and the ownerNode attribute will contain the Node.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet
member.summary: The StyleSheet interface is the abstract base interface for any type of style sheet. It represents a single style sheet associated with a structured document. In HTML, the StyleSheet interface represents either an external style sheet, included via the HTML LINK element, or an inline STYLE element. In XML, this interface represents an external style sheet, included via a style sheet processing instruction.
Used to find matching style rules in the cascading order
member.param: The element to find styles for
The pseudo-element to find styles for
The medialist that the document is using
A CssStyleDeclaration that holds the collected styles

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.Media
member.summary: The intended destination media for style information. The media is often specified in the ownerNode. If no media has been specified, the MediaList will be empty. See the media attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the media pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction . Modifying the media list may cause a change to the attribute disabled.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.Title
member.summary: The advisory title. The title is often specified in the ownerNode. See the title attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the title pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.Href
member.summary: If the style sheet is a linked style sheet, the value of its attribute is its location. For inline style sheets, the value of this attribute is null. See the href attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the href pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.AbsoluteHref
member.summary: The resolved absolute URL to the stylesheet

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.ParentStyleSheet
member.summary: For style sheet languages that support the concept of style sheet inclusion, this attribute represents the including style sheet, if one exists. If the style sheet is a top-level style sheet, or the style sheet language does not support inclusion, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.OwnerNode
member.summary: The node that associates this style sheet with the document. For HTML, this may be the corresponding LINK or STYLE element. For XML, it may be the linking processing instruction. For style sheets that are included by other style sheets, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.Disabled
member.summary: false if the style sheet is applied to the document. true if it is not. Modifying this attribute may cause a new resolution of style for the document. A stylesheet only applies if both an appropriate medium definition is present and the disabled attribute is false. So, if the media doesn't apply to the current user agent, the disabled attribute is ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.ReportsCore.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.StyleSheets.StyleSheet.Type
member.summary: This specifies the style sheet language for this style sheet. The style sheet language is specified as a content type (e.g. "text/css"). The content type is often specified in the ownerNode. Also see the type attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the type pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle
member.summary: Type of code, or symbology, the barcode control will use to generate the barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Ansi39
member.summary: ANSI 3 of 9 (Code 39) uses upper case, numbers, - , * $ / + %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Ansi39x
member.summary: ANSI Extended 3 of 9 (Extended Code 39) uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_2_of_5
member.summary: Code 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code25intlv
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code25mat
member.summary: Code25mat

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Matrix_2_of_5
member.summary: Matrix 2 of 5 is a higher density barcode consisting of 3 black bars and 2 white bars. Matrix_2_of_5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 uses numbers, % * $ /. , - +, and upper case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code39x
member.summary: Extended Code 39 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_A
member.summary: Code 128 A uses control characters, numbers, punctuation, and upper case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_B
member.summary: Code 128 B uses punctuation, numbers, upper case and lower case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_C
member.summary: Code 128 C uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128auto
member.summary: Code 128 Auto

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_93
member.summary: Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code93x
member.summary: Extended Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MSI
member.summary: MSI Code uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.PostNet
member.summary: PostNet uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar uses A B C D + - : , / and numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.EAN_8
member.summary: EAN-8 uses only numbers (7 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.EAN_13
member.summary: EAN-13 uses only numbers (12 numbers and a check digit). If there are only 12 numbers in the string, it calculates a checksum and adds it to the thirteenth position. If there are 13, it validates the checksum and throws an error if it is incorrect.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UPC_A
member.summary: UPC-A uses only numbers (11 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UPC_E0
member.summary: UPC-E0 uses only numbers. Used for zero-compression UPC symbols. For the Caption property, you may enter either a six-digit UPC-E code or a complete 11-digit (includes code type, which must be 0 (zero)) UPC-A code. If an 11-digit code is entered, the Barcode control will convert it to a six-digit UPC-E code, if possible. If it is not possible to convert from the 11-digit code to the six-digit code, nothing is displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UPC_E1
member.summary: UPC-E1 uses only numbers. Used typically for shelf labeling in the retail environment. The length of the input string for U.P.C. E1 is six numeric characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RM4SCC
member.summary: Royal Mail RM4SCC uses only letters and numbers (with a check digit). This is the barcode used by the Royal Mail in the United Kingdom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UCCEAN128
member.summary: UCC/EAN 128 uses the complete ASCII character Set. This is a special version of Code 128 used in HIBC applications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.QRCode
member.summary: QRCode is a 2D symbology that is capable of handling numeric, alphanumeric and byte data as well as Japanese kanji and kana characters. This symbology can encode up to 7,366 characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code49
member.summary: Code 49 is a 2D high-density stacked barcode. Encodes the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.JapanesePostal
member.summary: This is the barcode used by the Japanese Postal system. Encodes alpha and numeric characters consisting of 18 digits including a 7-digit postal code number, optionally followed by block and house number information. The data to be encoded can include hyphens.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Pdf417
member.summary: Pdf417 is a popular high-density 2-dimensional symbology that encodes up to 1108 bytes of information. This barcode consists of a stacked set of smaller barcodes. Encodes the full ASCII character set. Capable of encoding as many as 2725 data characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.EAN128FNC1
member.summary: EAN-128 is an alphanumeric one-dimensional representation of Application Identifier data. It is not meant for point-of-sales use, but for marking containers in the shipping industry.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14
member.summary: RSS14 is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14Truncated
member.summary: RSS14Truncated is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus Indicator digits for use on small items, not for point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14Stacked
member.summary: RSS14Stacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14Truncated, but stacked in two rows when RSS14Truncated is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14StackedOmnidirectional
member.summary: RSS14StackedOmnidirectional is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14, but stacked in two rows when RSS14 is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSSExpanded
member.summary: RSSExpanded is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus AI element strings (expiration date, weight, etc.) for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSSExpandedStacked
member.summary: RSSExpandedStacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSSExpanded, but stacked in two rows when RSSExpanded is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSSLimited
member.summary: RSS Limited is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification with indicator digits of 0 or 1 in a small symbol that is not scanned by point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.DataMatrix
member.summary: Data Matrix is a high density, two-dimensional barcode with square modules arranged in a square or rectangular matrix pattern.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MicroPDF417
member.summary: MicroPDF417 is two-dimensional (2D), multi-row symbology, derived from PDF417. Micro-PDF417 is designed for applications that need to encode data in a two-dimensional (2D) symbol (up to 150 bytes, 250 alphanumeric characters, or 366 numeric digits) with the minimal symbol size.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MicroQRCode
member.summary: Micro QR Code is a variant of QR Code, with reduced barcode size. It has only one position detection pattern.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MaxiCode
member.summary: MaxiCode is special polar barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.GS1QRCode
member.summary: GS1 QRCode

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.IntelligentMail
member.summary: Intelligent Mail, formerly known as the 4-State Customer Barcode, is a 65-bar code used for domestic mail in the U.S.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ITF14
member.summary: Interleaved Two of Five. This code is used to mark cartons and palettes that are including goods with an EAN-13 code. One digit is added in front of the EAN-13 code to mark the packing variant.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_11
member.summary: Encodes the numbers 0 through 9, the hyphen (-), and start/stop characters. It is primarily used in labeling telecommunications equipment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.SSCC_18
member.summary: SSCC_18 is an 18-digit Serial Shipping Container Code. It is used to identify individual shipping containers for tracking purposes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Telepen
member.summary: Telepen has 2 different modes - alphanumeric-only and numeric-only. Both modes require a start character, a check digit, and a stop character. It is mainly used in manufacturing industries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Pharmacode
member.summary: Pharmacode represents only numeric data from 3 to 131070. It is a barcode standard used in the pharmaceutical industry for packaging. It is designed to be readable despite printing errors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.PZN
member.summary: PZN Pharmaceutical Central/General Number uses the same encoding algorithm as Code 39 but can carry only digits 0123456789. The number of digits supported for encoding are 6 or 7. The letters 'PZN' and checksum digit are automatically added. It is mainly used to identify medicine and health-care products in Germany and other German-speaking countries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.HIBCCode128
member.summary: HIBCCode128 barcode uses the Code128 symbology. It encodes 'Primary Data' and 'Secondary Data' using slash (/) as delimiter. It is used in the health care products industry for identification purpose.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.HIBCCode39
member.summary: HIBCCode39 barcode uses the Code39 symbology, with Code39OptionalCheckDigit property set to True. It encodes 'Primary Data' and 'Secondary Data' using slash (/) as delimiter. It is used in the health care products industry for identification purpose.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ISBN
member.summary: International Standard Book Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code and is used as a unique 9-digit commercial book identifier.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ISSN
member.summary: International Standard Serial Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code. It is used to identify serial publications, publications that are issued in numerical order, such as the volumes of a magazine.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ISMN
member.summary: Internationally Standard Music Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code. It is used for marking printed musical publications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.IATA_2_of_5
member.summary: IATA_2_of_5 is a variant of Code_2_of_5 and uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.BC412
member.summary: Data BC412 uses 35 characters, 0 - 9 and A - Z. It is designed for semiconductor wafer identification.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Plessey
member.summary: Plessey uses hexadecimal digits to encode. It is a one-dimensional barcode used mainly in libraries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.IntelligentMailPackage
member.summary: IntelligentMailPackage is more efficient in terms of processing and tracking mails than Intelligent Mail barcode.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection
member.summary: Specifies the print direction of the barcode symbol.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed left to right (default).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed right to left.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed top to bottom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.BottomToTop
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed bottom to top.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.Rotation
member.summary: Defines the orientation of the bars in the barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.Rotation.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.Rotation.Rotate90Degrees
member.summary: 90 degrees

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.Rotation.Rotate180Degrees
member.summary: 180 degrees

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.Rotation.Rotate270Degrees
member.summary: 270 degrees

member.summary: Provides possibility for barcode rendering directly to RDF page.

member.summary: Ptovide the orientation of the barcode data
Render barcode to drawing device
member.param: Action for error message rendering into drawing device. It has next parameters: error message, forecolor, backcolor, barcode style

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.ILayoutManager.Measure(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutContext)
member.devdocs: Current implementation of layout subsystem assumes that this method will return actual extents encapsulated into . Nevertheless, it may be sufficient to return only approximate partial size (low end approximation) as long as the layout manager knows that the item (content being measured) will exceed current page dimensions ( for more details) for the current target device and a complete accurate measurement of the item is expensive.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities
member.summary: Specifies what layout options are available for the report item. This enumeration is used with the property.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.None
member.summary: The report item size remains fixed regardless of the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanShrinkVertically
member.summary: The report item can shrink vertically to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanShrinkHorizontally
member.summary: The report item can shrink horizontally to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanGrowVertically
member.summary: The report item can grow vertically to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanGrowHorizontally
member.summary: The report item can grow horizontally to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanSplitVertically
member.summary: When the contents do not fit, the top portion of the report item can be rendered on the current page and the bottom portion on the following page. The default behavior is for the entire report item to move to the following page.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanSplitHorizontally
member.summary: When the contents do not fit, the left portion of the report item can be rendered on the current page and the right portion on the following page. The default behavior is for the entire report item to move to the following page.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.BarCodes.IBarCode.Init(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the BarCode.
member.param: Some barcodes specify that a check digit must be included into the barcode. The check digit is usually an additional character (or several characters) that is appended to the input Data string and encoded into the barcode. The CheckDigit helps the scanner to verify that the data that it reads is correct and complete. For the Code39 barcode, the CheckDigit is optional. You can specify Yes or No to include or exclude it.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.Layout.Boxes.ContainingBlock
member.summary: Represents a CSS ContainerBlock
member.remarks:
From: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visuren.html#containing-block
9.1.2 Containing blocks
In CSS2.1, many box positions and sizes are calculated with respect to the edges of a rectangular box called a containing block. In containing block in which the box lives," not the one it generates.
Each box is given a position with respect to its containing block, but it is not confined by this containing block; it may overflow.
The details of how a containing block's dimensions are calculated are described in the next chapter.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.Layout.Utils.TextHelper.TryParseInt32(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its 32-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the operation succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 32-bit signed integer value equivalent to the number contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not of the correct format, or represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssCharsetRule
member.summary: The CSSCharsetRule interface represents a @charset rule in a CSS style sheet. The value of the encoding attribute does not affect the encoding of text data in the DOM objects; this encoding is always UTF-16. After a stylesheet is loaded, the value of the encoding attribute is the value found in the @charset rule. If there was no @charset in the original document, then no CSSCharsetRule is created. The value of the encoding attribute may also be used as a hint for the encoding used on serialization of the style sheet. The value of the @charset rule (and therefore of the CSSCharsetRule) may not correspond to the encoding the document actually came in; character encoding information e.g. in an HTTP header, has priority (see CSS document representation) but this is not reflected in the CSSCharsetRule.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssCharsetRule.#ctor(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.String[],GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssStyleSheetType)
member.summary: The constructor for CssCharSetRule
member.param: The Regex match that found the charset rule
The parent rule or parent stylesheet
True if this instance is readonly
An array of strings that have been replaced in the string used for matching. These needs to be put back use the DereplaceStrings method

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssCharsetRule.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding information used in this @charset rule

member.summary: The type of the rule. The expectation is that binding-specific casting methods can be used to cast down from an instance of the CSSRule interface to the specific derived interface implied by the type.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssMediaRule.InsertRule(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to insert a new rule into the media block
member.param: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.

The index within the media block's rule collection of the rule before which to insert the specified rule. If the specified index is equal to the length of the media blocks's rule collection, the rule will be added to the end of the media block.
member.returns: The index within the media block's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.
member.exception: HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at the specified index, e.g., if an @import rule is inserted after a standard rule set or other at-rule.
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index is not a valid insertion point.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this media rule is readonly
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified rule has a syntax error and is unparsable

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssPrimitiveValue
member.summary: The CSSPrimitiveValue interface represents a single CSS value. This interface may be used to determine the value of a specific style property currently set in a block or to set a specific style property explicitly within the block. An instance of this interface might be obtained from the getPropertyCSSValue method of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface. A CSSPrimitiveValue object only occurs in a context of a CSS property. Conversions are allowed between absolute values (from millimeters to centimeters, from degrees to radians, and so on) but not between relative values. (For example, a pixel value cannot be converted to a centimeter value.) Percentage values can't be converted since they are relative to the parent value (or another property value). There is one exception for color percentage values: since a color percentage value is relative to the range 0-255, a color percentage value can be converted to a number; (see also the RGBColor interface).

member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a float value.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssStyleDeclaration
member.summary: The CSSStyleDeclaration interface represents a single CSS declaration block. This interface may be used to determine the style properties currently set in a block or to set style properties explicitly within the block. While an implementation may not recognize all CSS properties within a CSS declaration block, it is expected to provide access to all specified properties in the style sheet through the CSSStyleDeclaration interface. Furthermore, implementations that support a specific level of CSS should correctly handle CSS shorthand properties for that level. For a further discussion of shorthand properties, see the CSS2Properties interface. This interface is also used to provide a read-only access to the computed values of an element. See also the ViewCSS interface. Note: The CSS Object Model doesn't provide an access to the specified or actual values of the CSS cascade

member.summary: The Counter interface is used to represent any counter or counters function value. This interface reflects the values in the underlying style property.

member.summary: This attribute is used for the separator of the nested counters.

member.summary: This attribute is used for the style of the list.

member.summary: This attribute is used for the identifier of the counter.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssCharsetRule
member.summary: The CSSCharsetRule interface represents a @charset rule in a CSS style sheet. The value of the encoding attribute does not affect the encoding of text data in the DOM objects; this encoding is always UTF-16. After a stylesheet is loaded, the value of the encoding attribute is the value found in the @charset rule. If there was no @charset in the original document, then no CSSCharsetRule is created. The value of the encoding attribute may also be used as a hint for the encoding used on serialization of the style sheet.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssCharsetRule.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding information used in this @charset rule.
member.exception: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified encoding value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this encoding rule is readonly.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssFontFaceRule
member.summary: The CSSFontFaceRule interface represents a @font-face rule in a CSS style sheet. The @font-face rule is used to hold a set of font descriptions.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssFontFaceRule.Style
member.summary: The declaration-block of this rule.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssImportRule
member.summary: The CSSImportRule interface represents a @import rule within a CSS style sheet. The @import rule is used to import style rules from other style sheets.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssImportRule.StyleSheet
member.summary: The style sheet referred to by this rule, if it has been loaded. The value of this attribute is null if the style sheet has not yet been loaded or if it will not be loaded (e.g. if the style sheet is for a media type not supported by the user agent).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssImportRule.Media
member.summary: A list of media types for which this style sheet may be used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssImportRule.Href
member.summary: The location of the style sheet to be imported. The attribute will not contain the "url(...)" specifier around the URI.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssMediaRule
member.summary: The CSSMediaRule interface represents a @media rule in a CSS style sheet. A @media rule can be used to delimit style rules for specific media types

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssMediaRule.DeleteRule(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to delete a rule from the media block.
member.param: The index within the media block's rule collection of the rule to remove.
member.exception: INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the media rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this media rule is readonly

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssMediaRule.InsertRule(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to insert a new rule into the media block.
member.param: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.

The index within the media block's rule collection of the rule before which to insert the specified rule. If the specified index is equal to the length of the media blocks's rule collection, the rule will be added to the end of the media block.
member.returns: The index within the media block's rule collection of the newly inserted rule

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssMediaRule.CssRules
member.summary: A list of all CSS rules contained within the media block.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssMediaRule.Media
member.summary: A list of media types for this rule

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPageRule
member.summary: The CSSPageRule interface represents a @page rule within a CSS style sheet. The @page rule is used to specify the dimensions, orientation, margins, etc. of a page box for paged media.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPageRule.Style
member.summary: The declaration-block of this rule.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPageRule.SelectorText
member.summary: The parsable textual representation of the page selector for the rule.
member.exception: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this rule is readonly.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue
member.summary: The CSSPrimitiveValue interface represents a single CSS value. This interface may be used to determine the value of a specific style property currently set in a block or to set a specific style property explicitly within the block. An instance of this interface might be obtained from the getPropertyCSSValue method of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface. A CSSPrimitiveValue object only occurs in a context of a CSS property.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.PrimitiveType
member.summary: The type of the value as defined by the constants specified above.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.SetFloatValue(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssPrimitiveType,System.Double)
member.summary: A method to set the float value with a specified unit. If the property attached with this value can not accept the specified unit or the float value, the value will be unchanged and a DOMException will be raised
member.param: A unit code as defined above. The unit code can only be a float unit type (i.e. CSS_NUMBER, CSS_PERCENTAGE, CSS_EMS, CSS_EXS, CSS_PX, CSS_CM, CSS_MM, CSS_IN, CSS_PT, CSS_PC, CSS_DEG, CSS_RAD, CSS_GRAD, CSS_MS, CSS_S, CSS_HZ, CSS_KHZ, CSS_DIMENSION).
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the attached property doesn't support the float value or the unit type.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.GetFloatValue(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssPrimitiveType)
member.summary: This method is used to get a float value in a specified unit. If this CSS value doesn't contain a float value or can't be converted into the specified unit, a DOMException is raised.
member.param: A unit code to get the float value. The unit code can only be a float unit type (i.e. CSS_NUMBER, CSS_PERCENTAGE, CSS_EMS, CSS_EXS, CSS_PX, CSS_CM, CSS_MM, CSS_IN, CSS_PT, CSS_PC, CSS_DEG, CSS_RAD, CSS_GRAD, CSS_MS, CSS_S, CSS_HZ, CSS_KHZ, CSS_DIMENSION).
member.returns: The float value in the specified unit.
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a float value or if the float value can't be converted into the specified unit.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.SetStringValue(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.CssPrimitiveType,System.String)
member.summary: A method to set the string value with the specified unit. If the property attached to this value can't accept the specified unit or the string value, the value will be unchanged and a DOMException will be raised.
member.param: A string code as defined above. The string code can only be a string unit type (i.e. CSS_STRING, CSS_URI, CSS_IDENT, and CSS_ATTR).
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a string value or if the string value can't be converted into the specified unit.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.GetStringValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the string value. If the CSS value doesn't contain a string value, a DOMException is raised. Note: Some properties (like 'font-family' or 'voice-family') convert a whitespace separated list of idents to a string.
member.returns: The string value in the current unit. The current primitiveType can only be a string unit type (i.e. CSS_STRING, CSS_URI, CSS_IDENT and CSS_ATTR).
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a string value.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.GetCounterValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the Counter value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a counter value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Counter interface
member.returns: The Counter value
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a Counter value (e.g. this is not CSS_COUNTER).

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.GetRectValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the Rect value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a rect value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Rect interface.
member.returns: The Rect value
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a Rect value. (e.g. this is not CSS_RECT).

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssPrimitiveValue.GetRgbColorValue
member.summary: This method is used to get the RGB color. If this CSS value doesn't contain a RGB color value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the RGBColor interface.
member.returns: the RGB color value.
member.exception: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the attached property can't return a RGB color value (e.g. this is not CSS_RGBCOLOR).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRule
member.summary: The CSSRule interface is the abstract base interface for any type of CSS statement. This includes both rule sets and at-rules. An implementation is expected to preserve all rules specified in a CSS style sheet, even if the rule is not recognized by the parser. Unrecognized rules are represented using the CSSUnknownRule interface.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRule.ParentStyleSheet
member.summary: The type of the rule, as defined above. The expectation is that binding-specific casting methods can be used to cast down from an instance of the CSSRule interface to the specific derived interface implied by the type.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRule.ParentRule
member.summary: The style sheet that contains this rule.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRule.Type
member.summary: If this rule is contained inside another rule (e.g. a style rule inside an @media block), this is the containing rule. If this rule is not nested inside any other rules, this returns null

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRule.CssText
member.summary: The parsable textual representation of the rule. This reflects the current state of the rule and not its initial value
member.exception: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value represents a different type of rule than the current one.
HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at this point in the style sheet.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if the rule is readonly.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRuleList
member.summary: The CSSRuleList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of CSS rules.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRuleList.Length
member.summary: The number of CSSRules in the list. The range of valid child rule indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssRuleList.Item(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to retrieve a CSS rule by ordinal index. The order in this collection represents the order of the rules in the CSS style sheet. If index is greater than or equal to the number of rules in the list, this returns null.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleCollector
member.summary: Defines an interface for collecting css value information.
Collects the css value based on name, specificity, origin and priority.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration
member.summary: The CSSStyleDeclaration interface represents a single CSS declaration block. This interface may be used to determine the style properties currently set in a block or to set style properties explicitly within the block.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.SetProperty(System.String,System.String,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.PropertyPriority)
member.summary: Used to set a property value and priority within this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
The new value of the property.
The new priority of the property (e.g. "important").
member.exception: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or the property is readonly.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyPriority(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the priority of a CSS property (e.g. the "important" qualifier) if the property has been explicitly set in this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: A string representing the priority (e.g. "important") if one exists. The empty string if none exists.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.RemoveProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Used to remove a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns the empty string if the property has not been set or the property name does not correspond to a known CSS property.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or the property is readonly.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the object representation of the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block. This method returns null if the property is a shorthand property. Shorthand property values can only be accessed and modified as strings, using the getPropertyValue and setProperty methods.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns null if the property has not been set.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.
member.param: The name of the CSS property. See the CSS property index.
member.returns: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns the empty string if the property has not been set.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.ParentRule
member.summary: The CSS rule that contains this declaration block or null if this CSSStyleDeclaration is not attached to a CSSRule.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleDeclaration.CssText
member.summary: The parsable textual representation of the declaration block (excluding the surrounding curly braces). Setting this attribute will result in the parsing of the new value and resetting of all the properties in the declaration block including the removal or addition of properties.
member.exception: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or a property is readonly.

member.summary: The textual representation of the selector for the rule set. The implementation may have stripped out insignificant whitespace while parsing the selector.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleSheet
member.summary: The CSSStyleSheet interface is a concrete interface used to represent a CSS style sheet i.e., a style sheet whose content type is "text/css".

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleSheet.DeleteRule(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to delete a rule from the style sheet.
member.param: The index within the style sheet's rule list of the rule to remove.
member.exception: INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the style sheet's rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this style sheet is readonly.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleSheet.InsertRule(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Used to insert a new rule into the style sheet. The new rule now becomes part of the cascade.
member.param: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.

The index within the style sheet's rule list of the rule before which to insert the specified rule. If the specified index is equal to the length of the style sheet's rule collection, the rule will be added to the end of the style sheet.
member.returns: The index within the style sheet's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.
member.exception: HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at the specified index e.g. if an @import rule is inserted after a standard rule set or other at-rule.
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the style sheet's rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this style sheet is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified rule has a syntax error and is unparsable.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleSheet.CssRules
member.summary: The list of all CSS rules contained within the style sheet. This includes both rule sets and at-rules.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.ICssStyleSheet.OwnerRule
member.summary: If this style sheet comes from an @import rule, the ownerRule attribute will contain the CSSImportRule. In that case, the ownerNode attribute in the StyleSheet interface will be null. If the style sheet comes from an element or a processing instruction, the ownerRule attribute will be null and the ownerNode attribute will contain the Node.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Css.RgbColor
member.summary: The RGBColor interface is used to represent any RGB color value. This interface reflects the values in the underlying style property. Hence, modifications made to the CSSPrimitiveValue objects modify the style property. A specified RGB color is not clipped (even if the number is outside the range 0-255 or 0%-100%). A computed RGB color is clipped depending on the device. Even if a style sheet can only contain an integer for a color value, the internal storage of this integer is a float, and this can be used as a float in the specified or the computed style. A color percentage value can always be converted to a number and vice versa

member.summary: A list containing all the style sheets explicitly linked into or embedded in a document. For HTML documents, this includes external style sheets, included via the HTML LINK element, and inline STYLE elements. In XML, this includes external style sheets, included via style sheet processing instructions (see [XML-StyleSheet]).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.ILinkStyle
member.summary: The LinkStyle interface provides a mechanism by which a style sheet can be retrieved from the node responsible for linking it into a document. An instance of the LinkStyle interface can be obtained using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of a linking node (HTMLLinkElement, HTMLStyleElement or ProcessingInstruction in DOM Level 2).

member.summary: The MediaList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of media, without defining or constraining how this collection is implemented. An empty list is the same as a list that contains the medium "all".

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet
member.summary: The StyleSheet interface is the abstract base interface for any type of style sheet. It represents a single style sheet associated with a structured document. In HTML, the StyleSheet interface represents either an external style sheet, included via the HTML LINK element, or an inline STYLE element. In XML, this interface represents an external style sheet, included via a style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.Media
member.summary: The intended destination media for style information. The media is often specified in the ownerNode. If no media has been specified, the MediaList will be empty. See the media attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the media pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction . Modifying the media list may cause a change to the attribute disabled.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.Title
member.summary: The advisory title. The title is often specified in the ownerNode. See the title attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the title pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.Href
member.summary: If the style sheet is a linked style sheet, the value of its attribute is its location. For inline style sheets, the value of this attribute is null. See the href attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the href pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.ParentStyleSheet
member.summary: For style sheet languages that support the concept of style sheet inclusion, this attribute represents the including style sheet, if one exists. If the style sheet is a top-level style sheet, or the style sheet language does not support inclusion, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.OwnerNode
member.summary: The node that associates this style sheet with the document. For HTML, this may be the corresponding LINK or STYLE element. For XML, it may be the linking processing instruction. For style sheets that are included by other style sheets, the value of this attribute is null

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.Disabled
member.summary: false if the style sheet is applied to the document. true if it is not. Modifying this attribute may cause a new resolution of style for the document. A stylesheet only applies if both an appropriate medium definition is present and the disabled attribute is false. So, if the media doesn't apply to the current user agent, the disabled attribute is ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.FormattedText.SharpVectors.Dom.Stylesheets.IStyleSheet.Type
member.summary: This specifies the style sheet language for this style sheet. The style sheet language is specified as a content type (e.g. "text/css"). The content type is often specified in the ownerNode. Also see the type attribute definition for the LINK element in HTML 4.0, and the type pseudo-attribute for the XML style sheet processing instruction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Expressions.ExpressionObjectModel.ParameterType.DateTime
member.summary: Specifies an ISO 8601 date/time value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Expressions.ExpressionObjectModel.ParameterType.Integer
member.summary: Specifies an integral number.
member.remarks: For a calendar date format the date string as follows: YYYY-MM-DD For example 2003-04-01 represents the first day of April in 2003. For a date and time, format the string as follows: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss Note that the T serves a seperator between the date and time. For example 2003-04-01T13:01:02 represents one minute and two seconds after one o'clock in the afternoon of 2003-04-01. Without any further additions, a date and time is assumed to be in a local time zone. To indicate the time is measured in UTC, you can append a capital letter Z to the end of the time string.

member.name: T:zxing.microqrcode.common.ByteMatrix
member.summary:
A class which wraps a 2D array of bytes. The default usage is signed. If you want to use it as a unsigned container, it's up to you to do byteValue & 0xff at each location.
JAVAPORT: The original code was a 2D array of ints, but since it only ever gets assigned -1, 0, and 1, I'm going to use less memory and go with bytes.

member.name: T:zxing.microqrcode.common.reedsolomon.GF256

summary.p: This class contains utility methods for performing mathematical operations over the Galois Field GF(256). Operations use a given primitive polynomial in calculations.
Throughout this package, elements of GF(256) are represented as an int for convenience and speed (but at the cost of memory). Only the bottom 8 bits are really used.

member.author: Sean Owen
www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source

member.summary: Create a representation of GF(256) using the given primitive polynomial.
member.param: irreducible polynomial whose coefficients are represented by the bits of an int, where the least-significant bit represents the constant coefficient

member.returns: the monomial representing coefficient * x^degree

member.summary: Implements both addition and subtraction -- they are the same in GF(256).
member.returns: sum/difference of a and b

member.returns: 2 to the power of a in GF(256)

member.name: M:zxing.microqrcode.common.reedsolomon.GF256.log(System.Int32)
member.returns: base 2 log of a in GF(256)

member.returns: multiplicative inverse of a

member.name: T:com.google.zxing.microqrcode.encoder.Encoder
member.author: satorux@google.com (Satoru Takabayashi) - creator

www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source

member.name: M:com.google.zxing.microqrcode.encoder.Encoder.encode(System.String,com.google.zxing.qrcode.decoder.ErrorCorrectionLevel,com.google.zxing.microqrcode.encoder.MicroQRCode,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Encode "bytes" with the error correction level "ecLevel". The encoding mode will be chosen internally by chooseMode(). On success, store the result in "qrCode".
We recommend you to use QRCode.EC_LEVEL_L (the lowest level) for "getECLevel" since our primary use is to show QR code on desktop screens. We don't need very strong error correction for this purpose.
Note that there is no way to encode bytes in MODE_KANJI. We might want to add EncodeWithMode() with which clients can specify the encoding mode. For now, we don't need the functionality.

member.name: M:com.google.zxing.microqrcode.encoder.Encoder.getAlphanumericCode(System.Int32)
member.returns: the code point of the table used in alphanumeric mode or -1 if there is no corresponding code in the table.

member.summary: Choose the best mode by examining the content. Note that 'encoding' is used as a hint; if it is Shift_JIS, and the input is only double-byte Kanji, then we return {@link Mode#KANJI}.

member.name: T:com.google.zxing.microqrcode.decoder.Version.ECBlocks
member.summary: See ISO 18004:2006 Annex E

summary.p: Encapsulates a set of error-correction blocks in one symbol version. Most versions will use blocks of differing sizes within one version, so, this encapsulates the parameters for each set of blocks. It also holds the number of error-correction codewords per block since it will be the same across all blocks within one version.

Encapsualtes the parameters for one error-correction block in one symbol version. This includes the number of data codewords, and the number of times a block with these parameters is used consecutively in the QR code version's format.
